name: Neem Tree

notable_features.fragrance: Distinct bitter aroma from leaves and bark
notable_features.medicinal_pods: Small, olive-like fruits used in traditional medicine and oil extraction

status.native_range: Indian subcontinent and tropical regions of Southeast Asia

traditional_medicinal_uses: Leaves used as an antiseptic, antifungal, and antibacterial agent
Bark decoctions used for malaria, fever, and skin diseases
Neem oil used to treat dandruff, lice, and skin conditions like eczema
Twigs traditionally used as natural toothbrushes (chewing sticks)
Seeds used in extracts for liver protection and immune boosting
safety_note: Neem oil can be toxic if consumed in large quantities, especially for children and pregnant women. External use is generally safe when diluted.

name: Aaptycha Zad

notable_features.fragrance: Mildly fragrant white or cream flowers
notable_features.medicinal_pods: Flat, elongated pods used in traditional remedies

traditional_medicinal_uses: Bark and leaves used to treat wounds and skin infections
Pods used in folk remedies for digestive issues
Leaves sometimes used in anti-inflammatory treatments
safety_note: Generally considered safe for external and traditional uses; ingestion should follow traditional dosage guidance.
